H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H5019.def: = man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} from 605-562 B.C. who led the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>} into exile

H4438.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H2492.def: = process by which an animal becomes physically strong

H2472.def: = process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H825.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in Babylon; ► working at the royal court

H2748.def: = title of priest skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found both in Egypt and Babylon; ► working at the royal court

H3784.def: = action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations

H3778.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>}

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H2472.def: = process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3778.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>}

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H762.def: = language used throughout the Near East as the primary international language of literature and communication from ca. 600 B.C.E. to ca. 700 C.E. ({A:ABD})

H1841.def: = man; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; one of the family heads who accompanied {L:Ezra<SDBH:עֶזְרָא>} back to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} after the exile; one of the signatories to the {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} document of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}
